title: Mountain Daughter/Quick guide

properties.name: description
properties.value: Note: Both tasks requested by Asleif (regarding Rellekka and finding a new food source) can be started at the same time. This reduces going back to the Mountain Camp multiple times.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Mountain Daughter/Quick guide
 This quick guide has an in-depth guide here.
It contains a more detailed description of dialogue, cutscenes, and storyline.

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Talk to Hamal the Chieftain in the Mountain Camp east of Rellekka. To get in, take the path north of the Golden Apple Tree and use a rope on the rock behind the guard (see below for more details).
Official difficultyIntermediate
DescriptionAges ago, a small tribe of people split off from the Fremennik in Rellekka and decided to inhabit the mountains to the east of town. There they lived as nomads for many years, but now the chieftain of the camp has lost his daughter and will not move on before she has been found. Has she run away, has she been eaten by trolls, or is there something more sinister going on? Only you can find out.
Official lengthMedium
Requirements
  • 20 Agility (boostable)
  • The ability to defeat a level 70 monster (can be safespotted)
Items required
  • Rope
  • Pickaxe
  • Axe
  • Plank
  • Staff or a pole (obtainable during the quest, Dramen Staff does not work, but elemental staves do work)
  • Gloves (excluding: Slayer, Mystic, Ranger, Moonclan, Lunar, vambraces, and random event apparel)
Recommended
  • 40 Combat level
  • Stamina or energy potions
  • Weight-reducing clothing
  • Fast travel to the White Wolf Mountain (Gnome Glider or alternatively a Camelot teleport)
  • Fast travel to the Mountain Camp (Slayer Ring or Fairy Rings to ajr and head north)
  • Fast travel to Rellekka (Enchanted lyre or Fremennik sea boots, or House teleport if your house is in Rellekka)
Enemies to defeat
  • The Kendal (level 70)

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Starting out[edit | edit source]

Map of the Mountain Camp.
  • Head to the entrance of the mountain camp east of Rellekka or north of the ajr fairy ring.
  • Take the path north, past the guard, and use your rope on a boulder you can push to get around.
  • Head into the camp and talk to Hamal the Chieftain. ( 1•1•1)…
    1Why is everyone being so hostile to me?
    1So what are you doing up here?
    1I will search for her!

Crisis[edit | edit source]

  • Dig some mud from the mud pond south of Hamal's house.
    • If you do not have a staff, go north of Hamal's house and take a pole. Keep this throughout the quest.
  • Go north, following the path along the lake westward.
  • Use the mud on the tall tree then climb it. You do *not* need to do this again for subsequent climbs.
  • Use your pole or staff on the clump of rocks to pole vault over.
  • Use your plank on the flat stones. Keep this throughout the quest.
  • Listen to the shining pool. ( 2•2•1•1)…
    2Hello! Who are you?
    2So what exactly do you want from me?
    1That sounds like something I can do.
    1I'll get right on it.
  • Use your plank on the flat stone to return to shore.

Making Peace[edit | edit source]

Note: Both tasks requested by Asleif (regarding Rellekka and finding a new food source) can be started at the same time. This reduces going back to the Mountain Camp multiple times.

The area that Svidi roams within.
  • Talk to Hamal the Chieftain about the people of Rellekka. ( 2•1)…
    2About the people of Rellekka...
    1Why do you hate them so much?
  • Search for Svidi between Rellekka and Keldagrim. ( 2)…
    2Can't I persuade you to go in there somehow?
  • Go to Rellekka and talk to Brundt the Chieftain in the longhall. ( 1•1)…
    1Ask about the mountain camp.
    1Did it contain vast magical powers?
    or ( 2•1)…
    2Ask about the mountain camp.
    1Did it contain vast magical powers?
    if Lunar Diplomacy started/completed.
  • Return to the Mountain Camp, and enter the large tent south-west of Hamal the Chieftain.
  • Use your pickaxe on the Ancient Rock located in the southern tent to get half a rock.
  • Take this back to Rellekka, and talk to Brundt the Chieftain ( 1)…
    1Ask about the mountain camp.
    or ( 2)…
    2Ask about the mountain camp.
    if Lunar Diplomacy started/completed, who will give you the guarantee of safe passage.
  • Take the guarantee to Svidi. You do not need to check on Svidi afterward.
  • Return to Hamal the Chieftain. ( 2)…
    2About the people of Rellekka...

The White Pearl[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to Hamal the Chieftan again, this time about food supplies. ( 3•1)…
    3About your food supplies...
    1Never mind.
  • Talk to Jokul just north of Hamal. He will tell you of a White Pearl plant that is very hardy.
  • Travel to White Wolf Mountain (Keldagrim minecart system if The Giant Dwarf completed, or Gnome glider if The Grand Tree completed.)
  • Equip gloves and pick-from the thorny bushes by the gnome glider.
  • Eat the white pearl you picked to get the white pearl seed.
  • Speak to Hamal the Chieftain to give him the white pearl seed. ( 2)…
    2About your food supplies...

The Kendal[edit | edit source]

Item required: Axe, Pole/Staff, Plank

Prepare to fight a level 70 creature that only uses melee.

  • Speak to the shining pool again (remember to use the pole/staff and plank).
  • Cross the gap back to shore without the plank, as this will put you closer to the cave.
  • Follow the northern path east to a cave.
  • Chop down the trees blocking your path (make sure you are facing east)
  • Enter the cave
  • Talk to The Kendal. ( 1•2•3•2•2•1)…
    1It's just me, no one special.
    2You mean a sacrifice?
    3You look like a man in a bearsuit!
    2Can I see that corpse?
    2I humbly request to be given the remains.
    1I will kill you myself!
  • Kill The Kendal. He can safespotted utilizing skeletons around the room.
  • Take the corpse of woman
  • Return to Hamal the Chieftain. ( 1•1)…
    1But he's not a god!
    1I will.
  • Gather 5 muddy rocks from around the camp.
  • Talk to Ragnar near the tall tree by the lake to get Asleif's necklace.
  • Return to the shining pool and bury the corpse.
  • Use the muddy rocks on the burial mound.(You make the mound by burying the corpse on the island.)

Quest complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 2 Quest points
  • 2,000 Prayer experience
  • 1,000 Attack experience
  • The Bearhead
  • The ability to pass into the Mountain Camp over the rockslide
